Description: A long string of cylinder and barrel disc beads: made of ostrich shell and dark-grey steatite, a few of light-brown semi-translucent steatite and three of very dark-red jasper. The shell beads are of uniform diameter but the others are all smaller and of various diameters.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 72, 85, 91; Grave register, pl. XXX.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (79)
